name: Cat Whiskers
climate: Cat Whiskers thrive in tropical climates where temperatures are warm year-round.
They prefer a humid climate, mimicking their native Southeast Asian habitats.
These plants cannot tolerate frost and require protection in cooler climates.
Ideal climate zones include USDA hardiness zones 10 to 11 for outdoor growth.
sunlight: Cat Whiskers need full sun to partial shade to bloom effectively.
Direct sunlight for at least 4 to 6 hours daily promotes healthy growth.
In very hot climates, some afternoon shade can prevent leaf scorch.
Insufficient sunlight may result in fewer flowers and leggier growth.
watering: Regular watering is necessary; they prefer consistently moist soil.
Avoid allowing the soil to dry completely between waterings.
Overwatering should be avoided to prevent root rot issues.
In hotter climates, they may require more frequent watering.
soil: Cat Whiskers thrive best in well-draining, slightly acidic soil.
A loamy soil enriched with organic matter supports healthy growth.
Avoid heavy clay soils that retain too much moisture and cause rot.
Raised beds or containers with adequate drainage work well for them.
extra_care_tip: Prune regularly to encourage bushy growth and remove spent flowers.
Mulching helps retain soil moisture and keeps roots cool in summer.
